Stringing together unlikable characters, unbelievable situations, and undigestible dialogue, "Inheritance" might work as a dark comedy. Unfortunately, the story of an impossibly young DA and the man kept in a bunker in her father's yard pushes forth with nary a glint of cleverness and clunks to the ground early and often in a series of played-straight thuds. All of it is both over the top and underdone, and the film lacks the sense to acknowledge the former or dress up the latter.
